short_summary: Remediate the Big Bar landslide on the Fraser River
description: The department invites tenders for engineering services to execute temporary operations and establish a long-term solution to fish passage at the slide site. DFO is currently assessing the effects and requires ongoing monitoring of hydraulic conditions and engineering support.
full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement

**Title:**
Engineering Services for Dynamic River Environment and Drafting/Illustration Services

**Reference Number:** cb-557-64597926

**Tender Status:** Expiré

**Notice Type:** Demande de propositions

**Procurement Method:** Concurrentielle - Invitation ouverte à soumissionner

## Project Overview
Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) issued a tender notice for the procurement of Engineering Services for a Dynamic River Environment and Drafting/ Illustration Services. The selected Service Provider will be responsible for remediating the impact of a landslide on the Fraser River, approximately 100 kilometers north of Lillooet, BC.

## Service Description
The scope of work includes ongoing monitoring of hydraulic conditions and engineering support to establish a long-term solution to fish passage at the slide site. The team is tasked with executing temporary operations and resolving the remaining effects of the landslide.

## Contract Details
- Estimated quantity of services: one (1) of each of the following:
  - Senior Professional Engineer
  - Junior Engineering Graduate
  - Senior Draftsperson/Illustrator
- Duration of contract: from contract award to May 31, 2028
- Time frame of delivery: from contract award to May 31, 2028

## Tender Documents
Tender documents for this bid solicitation, including the Request for Proposal (RFP) and any subsequent amendments, are available for download on the Canada Buys website. 

## Contact Information
For further information regarding this solicitation, please contact:

Richard Soulliere

(343) 576-2873

DFO.Tenders-Soumissions.MPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca

**Note:** This tender announcement has expired. Please refer to the original tender notice for any further clarification or directives.
